Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the amount of breaks provided by President Obama to the green energy world, as it states that $90 billion was given in one year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the $90 billion figure and the assertion that it was provided in one year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the breaks provided to the green energy world were the same as tax breaks given to the oil industry, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the $90 billion figure, such as it being distributed in different ways rather than solely as tax breaks.
